definition: to blow one's top/to be driven mad/to become frantic
to grab/to catch/to arrest/to snatch/to scratch

sentences.english: This delay is often a frustrating factor in cell-network data connections.
sentences.chinese: 延迟往往是蜂窝式网络中最令人抓狂的因素。

sentences.english: It drives me crazy and sometimes I've even thought of jumping out of the car and run!
sentences.chinese: 太让人抓狂了，有时候我甚至想跳出去跑着算了。

sentences.english: The crazy part to think about this is there's so many people laid off.
sentences.chinese: 但一想到现在那么多人都下岗了，还是有些令人抓狂。

sentences.english: Mark came unhinged when he noticed a scratch on his new car.
sentences.chinese: 马克发现他的车子有道刮痕时就抓狂了。

sentences.english: LOL, white people just mad that they no longer dominate swimming.
sentences.chinese: 哇哈哈，白人发现他们不再能支配泳池就抓狂了。

sentences.english: When you throw Mad Milk, it does have a chance to Crit. However, this makes no difference to its effects whatsoever.
sentences.chinese: 对敌人投掷抓狂牛奶不像瓶手道能获得助攻分数。

sentences.english: Want to get out of the craziness of Christmas shopping?
sentences.chinese: 想要远离使你抓狂的圣诞节大采购？

sentences.english: Desperate for that killer gift for those got-everything-already relatives?
sentences.chinese: 正在为那些把一切都准备好了的亲戚准备礼物抓狂吗？

sentences.english: Louis's WTHR. "The crazy part to think about this is there's so many people laid off.
sentences.chinese: 但一想到现在那么多人都下岗了，还是有些令人抓狂。

sentences.english: The fish smell drove me crazy.
After a year, I was going crazy with no people around me.
sentences.chinese: 离开前呼后拥的生活一年以后，我几乎要抓狂。

sentences.english: The songs remain fast and loud, totally wired and tantalizingly brief.
sentences.chinese: 快节奏嘹亮的歌曲，透露着怪异而又简洁得让人抓狂。

sentences.english: But people were even buying less fruit. That is simply insane.
sentences.chinese: 但是人们连水果都买得比以前少了，简直是抓狂了。

sentences.english: He searched frantically for a new card, but found none.
sentences.chinese: 他抓狂的找新的保险卡，但是没有找到。

sentences.english: No. Only physical attacks are allowed while Berserked.
sentences.chinese: 当抓狂的状态下，只会进行物理攻击。

sentences.english: It's almost as if it was made as thin as it is purely to demoralize would-be competitors.
sentences.chinese: 看起来做这么薄好像纯粹是为了让潜在的竞争者抓狂。

definition: to go mad/to go crazy/to lose one's mind
not well/out of sorts/in a bad mood/without discrepancy/accurate
to get mad/to be very angry
lit. heart distracted, thoughts in turmoil (idiom); distraught with anxiety
stamp with fury/fly into a rage
to stomp or hop about (in anxiety, anger etc)/to dance on one's feet/hopping mad (anxious, etc)
lit. not to know whether to laugh or cry (idiom)/both funny and extremely embarrassing/between laughter and tears
